intro: Acer sino-oblongum, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by orange-red samaras. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in temperate regions.
